page.title: 15COPPERAS WOOD -IMPRESSIONS
page.content: "On the 19th June 1985 we went to Copperas Wood.We had to keep to the path as the Government has designated the wood as an{Area of Scientific {Interest,}because it so rare. As you walk through the wood you can hear the birds singing in the trees. It is very peaceful apart from the faint sounds of traffic and trains.A dark and cool place full of life. We crossed the railway bridge and came to the shore. There was a thin mist floating over the water, cutting us off from the 20th century. We were completely cut off from other people, nobody to bother us, in our own world.A fishy smell, a smell of salt and seaweed touched our nosrils. The receeding tide had exposed the mud revealing crabs, small fish and other creatures. Its a lovely place to go."
